title: Persian Orange and Bean Stew
description: A flavorful Persian stew combining the tangy notes of orange and lime with kidney beans and jalapeño, served warm with flatbread.
steps: Place a large skillet over medium heat. Heat the oil in it. Add the onion and cook it for 6 minutes.
Stir in the spices and cook them for another 6 minutes. Add the orange and lime juice. Cook them until they start boiling. Cook them for 12 minutes over low heat.
Stir in the peppers with beans. Cook them for 22 minutes. Cook them for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve your stew warm with flatbread.
Enjoy.

title: Persian Potato Rice Stew
description: A hearty Persian stew featuring potatoes and rice, infused with aromatic spices for a comforting meal.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until golden, about 5 minutes.
Stir in turmeric and cook for 1 minute. Add potatoes and rice, stirring to coat.
Pour in vegetable broth, bring to a boil, then simmer for 45 minutes until potatoes and rice are tender.
Season with salt to taste. Serve warm.

title: Persian Nutty Rice
description: A fragrant rice dish with nuts and Persian spices, perfect as a side or main course.
steps: Cook basmati rice in boiling water until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain.
In a pan, melt butter and toast almonds and pistachios until golden, about 5 minutes.
Stir in saffron water and cooked rice. Mix gently and cook for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and serve warm.

title: Persian Pistachios and Bean Pilaf
description: A vibrant pilaf combining pistachios and beans with aromatic Persian spices.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté onion until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add cumin and pistachios, cook for 2 minutes. Stir in rice and beans.
Add water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes until rice is cooked.
Season with salt and serve warm.

title: Persian Noodles Bean Soup
description: A comforting Persian soup with noodles and beans, flavored with traditional herbs.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add beans and parsley, cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth, bring to a boil, add noodles, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and serve hot.

title: Persian Lemon Chicken Kabobs
description: Juicy chicken kabobs marinated with lemon and Persian spices, perfect for grilling.
steps: Mix lemon juice, olive oil, saffron, and salt to make a marinade.
Marinate chicken cubes for at least 1 hour.
Thread chicken onto skewers and grill over medium heat for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve hot with rice or flatbread.

title: Persian Chicken Wings Soup
description: A savory soup featuring chicken wings and Persian spices for a warming dish.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric and chicken wings, cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth, bring to a boil, then simmer for 45 minutes.
Season with salt and serve hot.

title: Potato and Pepper Meatballs
description: Flavorful meatballs with potatoes and peppers, infused with Persian spices.
steps: Mix ground beef, grated potato, bell pepper, onion, cumin, and salt in a bowl.
Form into meatballs and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan, cook meatballs until browned, about 10 minutes.
Simmer in a tomato-based sauce for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

title: Persian Chicken Berries Pilaf
description: A sweet and savory pilaf with chicken and berries, a classic Persian combination.
steps: Heat butter in a pan, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add chicken and cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in rice, barberries, and saffron water. Add water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and serve warm.

title: Persian Lime Lamb Stew
description: A tangy lamb stew with dried limes, a staple in Persian cuisine, for a rich and flavorful dish.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric and lamb, cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste and dried limes, then add water. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 75 minutes.
Season with salt and serve warm with rice.

title: Persian Zucchini Frittata
description: A light and flavorful Persian frittata featuring zucchini and fresh herbs, perfect for brunch or a light meal.
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet, sauté onion until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add grated zucchini and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Whisk eggs with dill, salt, and pepper. Pour over zucchini mixture.
Cook on low heat until set, about 15 minutes. Optionally, finish under a broiler for 2–3 minutes.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

title: Persian Spinach Frittata
description: A nutritious Persian frittata packed with spinach and herbs, ideal for a healthy meal.
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet, sauté onion until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes.
Whisk eggs with parsley, salt, and pepper. Pour over spinach mixture.
Cook on low heat until set, about 15 minutes. Optionally, finish under a broiler for 2–3 minutes.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

title: Glazed Lamb with Fruit Salad
description: Tender lamb glazed with Persian spices, served alongside a refreshing fruit salad.
steps: Mix pomegranate molasses, olive oil, saffron, and salt to make a glaze.
Coat lamb chops with glaze and marinate for 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-sear lamb chops over medium heat for 8–10 minutes per side.
Toss mixed fruits with lemon juice to make a salad.
Serve lamb chops with fruit salad on the side.

title: Persian Creamy Dill Chicken Salad
description: A creamy chicken salad with dill and Persian spices, perfect for a light meal or appetizer.
steps: Cook chicken breast by poaching or grilling, then shred.
Mix yogurt, dill, lemon juice, and salt to make a dressing.
Combine shredded chicken and cucumber with the dressing.
Chill for 20 minutes before serving.

title: Persian Saffron Kabobs
description: Succulent meat kabobs marinated with saffron and spices, a Persian classic.
steps: Blend saffron water, lemon juice, olive oil, grated onion, and salt to make a marinade.
Marinate meat cubes for at least 1 hour.
Thread meat onto skewers and grill over medium heat for 10–12 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve hot with rice or flatbread.

title: Persian Tongues Stew
description: A rich and unique stew featuring lamb tongue and Persian spices, slow-cooked for tenderness.
steps: Boil lamb tongues in water for 10 minutes, then peel and slice.
Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric, tomato paste, and dried limes, cook for 2 minutes.
Add sliced tongues and water, simmer for 100 minutes until tender.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Lentils and Meatballs Soup
description: A hearty soup with lentils and meatballs, flavored with Persian spices.
steps: Form ground beef into small meatballs.
Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric and lentils, stir for 1 minute.
Add broth and meatballs, bring to a boil, then simmer for 45 minutes.
Season with salt and serve hot.

title: Persian Eggplant Frittata
description: A savory frittata with roasted eggplant and Persian herbs, perfect for any meal.
steps: Roast eggplant until soft, about 20 minutes at 400°F, then mash.
Heat olive oil in a skillet, sauté onion until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add mashed eggplant and cook for 3 minutes.
Whisk eggs with parsley, salt, and pepper. Pour over eggplant mixture.
Cook on low heat until set, about 10 minutes. Optionally, finish under a broiler for 2–3 minutes.

title: Persian Nutty Duck
description: A rich duck dish with a nutty Persian sauce, showcasing bold flavors.
steps: Score duck skin and sear in a hot pan until crispy, about 5 minutes per side. Set aside.
In the same pan, heat olive oil and sauté onion until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add ground walnuts and pomegranate molasses, cook for 2 minutes.
Add water and simmer for 10 minutes. Slice duck and add to sauce, cook for 5 minutes.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Nutty Fruit Salad
description: A refreshing fruit salad with nuts and a hint of Persian rosewater.
steps: Combine pomegranate seeds, grapes, and pistachios in a bowl.
Mix rosewater, lemon juice, and honey to make a dressing.
Toss fruits and nuts with dressing.
Chill for 10 minutes before serving.

title: Persian Nutty Yogurt Soup
description: A creamy yogurt-based soup with nuts and herbs, served chilled for a refreshing dish.
steps: In a bowl, whisk yogurt with water until smooth.
Add chopped walnuts, cucumber, mint, and raisins. Stir to combine.
Season with salt to taste.
Chill for 15 minutes before serving cold.

title: Persian Rosy Rice Pudding
description: A fragrant rice pudding infused with rosewater and saffron, a classic Persian dessert.
steps: Cook rice in boiling water for 10 minutes, then drain.
In a pot, heat milk and add cooked rice. Simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add sugar and saffron water, cook for 10 minutes until thickened.
Stir in rosewater and remove from heat.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with pistachios.

title: Fenugreek Lamb Stew
description: A savory lamb stew with fenugreek leaves, offering a distinctive Persian flavor.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric and lamb, cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste and fenugreek leaves, cook for 2 minutes.
Add water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 75 minutes until lamb is tender.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Cinnamon Beef Stew
description: A rich beef stew infused with cinnamon and Persian spices for a warm, aromatic dish.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric, cinnamon, and beef, cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, cook for 2 minutes.
Add water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 75 minutes until beef is tender.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Lemon Kabobs
description: Juicy meat kabobs marinated with lemon and Persian spices, perfect for grilling.
steps: Mix lemon juice, saffron water, olive oil, grated onion, and salt to make a marinade.
Marinate meat cubes for at least 1 hour.
Thread meat onto skewers and grill over medium heat for 10–12 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve hot with rice or flatbread.

title: Cucumber, Onion, Parsley, and Tomato Salad (Shiraz)
description: A refreshing Persian salad from Shiraz, featuring crisp vegetables and a tangy dressing.
steps: Combine cucumber, tomato, onion, and parsley in a bowl.
Mix lemon juice, olive oil, and salt to make a dressing.
Toss vegetables with dressing.
Serve immediately or chill for 10 minutes.

title: Persian Meat and Kidney Bean Stew (Khoresh)
description: A hearty Persian khoresh with tender meat and kidney beans in a rich tomato sauce.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric and meat, cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste and dried limes, cook for 2 minutes.
Add kidney beans and water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 75 minutes.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: National Iranian Green Stew
description: A vibrant green stew packed with fresh herbs and tender meat, a Persian classic known as Ghormeh Sabzi.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add meat and cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in parsley, cilantro, chives, and fenugreek leaves, cook for 5 minutes.
Add kidney beans, dried limes, and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 100 minutes.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Saffron Rice
description: A fragrant basmati rice dish infused with saffron, a staple in Persian cuisine.
steps: Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear, then soak for 20 minutes and drain.
In a pot, bring water to a boil, add rice and salt, and cook for 10 minutes until partially cooked. Drain.
Melt butter in the same pot, add half the rice, drizzle with saffron water, then add remaining rice.
Cover and steam over low heat for 20 minutes until rice is fluffy.
Serve warm as a side dish.

title: Persian Pomegranate Chicken
description: A rich chicken stew with pomegranate molasses and walnuts, inspired by the classic Persian fesenjan.
steps: Toast ground walnuts in a dry pan until fragrant, about 5 minutes, then set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add chicken and cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in walnuts, pomegranate molasses, sugar, and water. Simmer for 40 minutes.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Herb Frittata (Kuku Sabzi)
description: A vibrant green frittata packed with fresh herbs, a Persian classic for any meal.
steps: In a bowl, whisk eggs with turmeric and salt.
Add chopped parsley, cilantro, dill, and green onions. Mix well.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Pour egg mixture into the skillet and cook for 10–12 minutes until set.
Flip or broil to cook the top, then serve warm or at room temperature.

title: Pomegranate and Walnut Salad
description: A refreshing salad with pomegranate seeds and walnuts, dressed with a tangy pomegranate molasses.
steps: Combine pomegranate seeds, walnuts, and mixed greens in a bowl.
Mix pomegranate molasses, olive oil, lemon juice, and salt to make a dressing.
Toss salad with dressing.
Serve immediately or chill for 10 minutes.

title: Persian Barberry Rice (Zereshk Polo)
description: A colorful basmati rice dish with tangy barberries and saffron, a Persian favorite.
steps: Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear, soak for 20 minutes, then drain.
In a pot, bring water to a boil, add rice and salt, cook for 10 minutes, then drain.
Melt butter in the pot, sauté barberries with sugar for 2 minutes.
Add half the rice, drizzle with saffron water, then add remaining rice.
Cover and steam over low heat for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

title: Chicken with Dried Apricots
description: A sweet and savory chicken dish with dried apricots and Persian spices.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric, cinnamon, and chicken, cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste and soaked apricots, cook for 2 minutes.
Add water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 45 minutes until chicken is tender.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Almond Cookies
description: Delicate almond cookies flavored with cardamom, a perfect Persian dessert.
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix almond flour, sugar, cardamom, and rosewater in a bowl.
Stir in melted butter to form a dough.
Shape into small balls, flatten slightly, and place on a baking sheet.
Garnish with slivered almonds and bake for 12–15 minutes until golden.
Cool before serving.

title: Eggplant and Tomato Stew (Khoresh Bademjan)
description: A rich Persian stew with eggplant and tender meat in a tangy tomato sauce.
steps: Fry eggplant slices in 2 tbsp olive oil until golden, then set aside.
In a pot, heat 1 tbsp olive oil, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric and meat, cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, chopped tomatoes, and dried limes, cook for 2 minutes.
Add water and eggplant, simmer for 60 minutes until meat is tender.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Spiced Meatballs (Koofteh)
description: Flavorful meatballs with herbs and rice, simmered in a rich tomato sauce.
steps: Mix ground meat, cooked rice, egg, parsley, grated onion, turmeric, and salt to form meatballs.
Heat olive oil in a pot, brown meatballs for 5–7 minutes, then remove.
In the same pot, sauté tomato paste for 2 minutes, add water, and bring to a boil.
Return meatballs to the pot and simmer for 45 minutes.
Serve warm with bread or rice.

title: Cucumber Yogurt Dip (Mast-o-Khiar)
description: A creamy yogurt dip with cucumber and mint, perfect as a side or appetizer.
steps: Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess water.
Mix yogurt, cucumber, fresh mint, dried mint, and salt in a bowl.
Chill for 10 minutes before serving.
Serve with flatbread or as a side.

title: Persian Rosewater Sorbet
description: A refreshing sorbet infused with rosewater, a light Persian dessert.
steps: In a saucepan, dissolve sugar in water over medium heat to make a syrup, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in lemon juice and rosewater, and let cool.
Pour into a shallow dish and freeze for 2 hours, stirring every 30 minutes.
Serve chilled as a light dessert.

title: Lamb and Split Pea Stew (Khoresh Gheymeh)
description: A traditional Persian stew with lamb, split peas, and dried limes in a tomato-based sauce.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric and lamb, cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste and dried limes, cook for 2 minutes.
Add soaked split peas and water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 75 minutes.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Jeweled Rice (Morasa Polo)
description: A festive basmati rice dish adorned with nuts, dried fruits, and saffron, perfect for special occasions.
steps: Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear, soak for 20 minutes, then drain.
Boil water, add rice and salt, cook for 10 minutes, then drain.
In a pan, melt 1 tbsp butter, sauté barberries, almonds, pistachios, and sugar for 3 minutes.
In a pot, melt 2 tbsp butter, layer half the rice, add saffron water, then add remaining rice.
Top with nut and fruit mixture, cover, and steam over low heat for 20 minutes.
Serve warm as a festive side.

title: Chicken and Plum Stew (Khoresh Aloo)
description: A tangy and sweet Persian stew with chicken and dried plums in a rich sauce.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot, sauté onion until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add turmeric and chicken, cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, dried plums, and saffron water, cook for 2 minutes.
Add water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 45 minutes until chicken is tender.
Season with salt and serve with rice.

title: Persian Chickpea Cookies (Nan-e Nokhodchi)
description: Delicate, melt-in-the-mouth cookies made with chickpea flour and cardamom.
steps: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Mix chickpea flour, powdered sugar, and cardamom in a bowl.
Stir in melted butter to form a soft dough.
Shape into small clover-shaped cookies and place on a baking sheet.
Garnish with pistachios and bake for 15–18 minutes until lightly golden.
Cool before serving.

title: Spinach and Yogurt Dip (Borani Esfenaj)
description: A creamy yogurt dip with sautéed spinach and garlic, perfect as a side or appetizer.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes. Let cool.
Mix spinach and garlic with yogurt in a bowl.
Season with salt and chill for 15 minutes.
Serve with flatbread or as a side.

title: Persian Grilled Fish
description: Tender fish fillets marinated with saffron and lemon, grilled to perfection.

ingredients.name: white fish fillets (e.g., cod or tilapia)

steps: Mix lemon juice, saffron water, olive oil, garlic, and salt to make a marinade.
Marinate fish fillets for 30 minutes.
Preheat grill to medium heat.
Grill fish for 4–5 minutes per side until cooked through.
Serve hot with rice or salad.

title: Saffron and Rosewater Ice Cream
description: A creamy Persian ice cream infused with saffron and rosewater, a delightful dessert.
steps: In a saucepan, heat milk, cream, and sugar until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes. Do not boil.
Remove from heat, stir in saffron water and rosewater, and let cool.
Churn in an ice cream maker for 20–25 minutes until set.
Freeze for 2 hours to firm up.
Serve with a sprinkle of pistachios.

title: Italian Baked Meatballs
description: Juicy homemade meatballs with Italian seasoning, baked to perfection.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix bread crumbs, Romano cheese, parsley, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder together.
Combine with water and eggs. Add ground beef and mix well.
Roll mixture into balls and place on a nonstick baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until browned, about 30 minutes.

title: Traditional Spaghetti all'Amatriciana
description: Classic Italian pasta dish with pancetta and tomato sauce.
steps: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti for about 12 minutes until al dente.
Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet and cook onion until golden (5 minutes).
Add pancetta and cook until crisp (2-3 minutes).
Pour in passata, water, and sugar; cook until thickened (10-15 minutes).
Drain spaghetti and toss with sauce, remaining oil, Parmesan, and red pepper flakes. Season.

title: Hearty Minestrone Soup (Instant Pot)
description: Vegetable-packed Italian soup with beef and pasta, made quickly in an Instant Pot.
steps: Heat oil in Instant Pot on Saute mode. Add beef and onion; cook 4 minutes.
Add celery, green beans, carrot, garlic, oregano, basil, and pepper. Stir.
Pour in broth, diced tomatoes, and crushed tomatoes. Select Soup setting.
Cook on high pressure for 35 minutes (10-15 min pressure build time).
Quick-release pressure (5 min). Stir in kidney beans and pasta.
Slow Cook mode for 10 minutes until pasta/vegetables are tender.
Season with salt. Serve topped with Parmesan and fresh basil.

title: Lasagne alla Bolognese Saporite
description: Rich Italian lasagna with meat sauce and creamy béchamel.
steps: Heat olive oil in saucepan over medium heat; cook onion, carrot, shallot, and prosciutto for 10 minutes.
Add pork and beef; season with nutmeg, cinnamon, and salt. Cook until browned (10 minutes).
Pour red wine over meat; cook until evaporated (3 minutes). Add tomatoes and simmer 1.5-2 hours.
Melt butter in saucepan; add flour. Whisk in milk and cook until thickened (10 minutes). Season.
Cook lasagna noodles for 8 minutes; drain and pat dry.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Layer sauce, noodles, white sauce, and cheese in baking dish.
Bake for 30-40 minutes until golden brown. Let stand 3-4 minutes before slicing.

title: Chicken Milano
description: Creamy sun-dried tomato chicken served over fettuccine.
steps: In saucepan over low heat, melt butter; add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add tomatoes and 3/4 cup broth; bring to boil then simmer 10 minutes.
Add cream and cook until thickened.
Season chicken with salt/pepper. Heat oil in skillet and sauté chicken 4 minutes per side.
In same skillet, bring remaining 1/4 cup broth to boil; add to cream sauce with basil.
Cook fettuccine 8-10 minutes; drain and toss with 3-4 tbsp sauce.
Slice chicken and serve over pasta with sauce.

title: Italian Sausage Soup with Tortellini
description: Hearty soup with Italian sausage, vegetables, and cheese tortellini.
steps: Brown sausage in Dutch oven; drain, reserving 1 tbsp drippings.
Sauté onions and garlic in drippings.
Stir in broth, water, wine, tomatoes, carrots, basil, oregano, and tomato sauce. Boil then simmer 30 minutes.
Skim fat; stir in zucchini and parsley. Simmer covered 30 minutes.
Add tortellini during last 10 minutes.
Serve with Parmesan cheese.

title: American Lasagna
description: Classic layered lasagna with ricotta and mozzarella.
steps: Brown beef, onion and garlic for 5 minutes; drain fat.
Mix in basil, oregano, brown sugar, salt, tomatoes and tomato paste. Simmer 30-45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook lasagna noodles 5-8 minutes; drain and blot dry.
Mix eggs, ricotta, Parmesan, parsley and 1 tsp salt.
Layer noodles, ricotta mixture, mozzarella and sauce in baking dish.
Bake 30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

title: Slow Cooker Italian Beef for Sandwiches
description: Tender shredded beef cooked with Italian seasonings, perfect for sandwiches.
steps: Combine water with all seasonings in saucepan; bring to boil.
Place roast in slow cooker; pour dressing mixture over meat.
Cover and cook on Low for 10-12 hours (or High 4-5 hours).
Remove bay leaf and shred meat with fork.

title: Balsamic Roasted Pork Loin
description: Juicy pork loin marinated in balsamic vinegar and herbs.
steps: Dissolve steak seasoning in vinegar; stir in olive oil.
Place pork in resealable bag with marinade; refrigerate 2 hours to overnight.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Place pork with marinade in baking dish; bake 1 hour until internal temp reaches 145°F (65°C).
Let rest 10 minutes before slicing.

title: Jamie's Minestrone
description: Vegetable-packed Italian soup with pasta and beans.
steps: Heat oil in stock pot; sauté garlic 2-3 minutes. Add onion; cook 4-5 minutes.
Add celery and carrots; sauté 1-2 minutes.
Add broth, water and tomato sauce; bring to boil. Add wine if desired.
Stir in kidney beans, green beans, spinach, zucchini, oregano, basil, salt and pepper. Simmer 30-40 minutes.
Cook pasta separately; drain.
Place 2 tbsp cooked pasta in bowls; ladle soup over top. Sprinkle with Parmesan.

title: ITALIAN BREADED PORK CHOPS
description: A classic Italian dish with breaded and baked pork chops.
steps: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C).
In a small bowl, beat together the eggs and milk.
In a separate small bowl, mix the bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, and parsley.
Heat the olive oil in a large, oven-proof skillet over medium heat.
Stir in the garlic, and cook until lightly browned.
Dip each pork chop into the egg mixture, then into the bread crumb mixture, coating evenly.
Place coated pork chops in the skillet, and brown about 5 minutes on each side.
Place the skillet and pork chops in the preheated oven, and cook 25 minutes.

title: SPINACH TOMATO TORTELLINI
description: A creamy spinach and tomato tortellini dish.
steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Add the tortellini, and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
While pasta cooks, combine tomatoes, spinach, salt, pepper, basil and garlic in a large saucepan.
Cook and stir until the mixture begins to bubble.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, milk and cream.
Stir into saucepan along with Parmesan cheese.
Heat through, then reduce heat to low, and simmer until thick, about 2 minutes.
Drain the tortellini and toss with sauce.

title: PEPPERED SHRIMP ALFREDO
description: A creamy Alfredo pasta with shrimp and vegetables.
steps: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Meanwhile, melt butter together with olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
Stir in onion, and cook until softened and translucent, about 2 minutes.
Stir in garlic, red pepper, and mushroom; cook over medium-high heat until soft, about 2 minutes more.
Stir in shrimp, and cook until firm and pink.
Pour in Alfredo sauce, Romano cheese, and cream; bring to a simmer.
Season with cayenne, salt, and pepper to taste.
Stir drained pasta into the sauce, and serve sprinkled with chopped parsley.

title: BEST MARINARA SAUCE YET
description: A flavorful homemade marinara sauce.
steps: In a food processor place Italian tomatoes, tomato paste, chopped parsley, minced garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Blend until smooth.
In a large skillet over medium heat saute the finely chopped onion in olive oil for 2 minutes.
Add the blended tomato sauce and white wine.
Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

title: THE BEST PARMESAN CHICKEN BAKE
description: Baked chicken with Parmesan cheese and marinara sauce.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Coat the bottom of a 9x13 inch casserole dish with olive oil, and sprinkle with garlic and hot red pepper flakes.
Arrange the chicken breasts in bottom of the dish, and pour marinara sauce over chicken.
Sprinkle basil over marinara sauce, and top with half the mozzarella cheese, followed by half the Parmesan cheese.
Sprinkle on the croutons, then top with the remaining mozzarella cheese and remaining Parmesan cheese.
Bake in preheated oven until cheese and croutons are golden brown and the chicken is no longer pink inside, about 35 minutes to an hour.

title: CHEF JOHN'S ITALIAN MEATBALLS
description: Classic Italian meatballs with ground beef and pork.
steps: Cover a baking sheet with foil and spray lightly with cooking spray.
Soak bread crumbs in milk in a small bowl for 20 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook and stir onions in hot oil until translucent, about 20 minutes.
Mix beef and pork together in a large bowl.
Stir in onions, bread crumb mixture, eggs, parsley, garlic, salt, black pepper, red pepper flakes, Italian herb seasoning, and Parmesan cheese.
Cover and refrigerate for about one hour.
Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Using wet hands, form meat mixture into balls about 1 1/2 inches in diameter.
Arrange onto prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until browned and cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes.

title: PESTO CHICKEN FLORENTINE
description: Chicken with pesto sauce and spinach served over pasta.
steps: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat.
Add garlic, saute for 1 minute; then add chicken and cook for 7 to 8 minutes on each side.
When chicken is close to being cooked through, add spinach and saute all together for 3 to 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare Alfredo sauce according to package directions.
When finished, stir in 2 tablespoons pesto; set aside.
In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente.
Drain and transfer to a bowl.
Add chicken/spinach mixture to pasta, then stir in pesto/Alfredo sauce.
Top with cheese and serve.

title: CHICKEN FETTUCCINI ALFREDO
description: Creamy fettuccini Alfredo with chicken.
steps: In a large skillet over medium heat combine chicken, 2 tablespoons butter, 2 cloves garlic, and Italian seasoning.
Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Meanwhile, melt 4 tablespoons butter in the skillet.
Saute onion, 2 cloves garlic, and mushrooms until onions are transparent.
Stir in flour, salt and pepper; cook 2 minutes.
Slowly add milk and half-and-half, stirring until smooth and creamy.
Stir in Parmesan and Colby-Monterey Jack cheeses; stir until cheese is melted.
Stir in chicken mixture, tomatoes and sour cream.
Serve over cooked fettuccini.

title: TIRAMISU LAYER CAKE
description: A delicious coffee-flavored Italian dessert cake.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 3 (9 inch) pans.
Prepare the cake mix according to package directions.
Divide two thirds of batter between 2 pans.
Stir instant coffee into remaining batter; pour into remaining pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes.
Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely.
In a measuring cup, combine brewed coffee and 1 tablespoon coffee liqueur; set aside.
To make the filling: In a small bowl, combine mascarpone, 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar and 2 tablespoons coffee liqueur; beat just until smooth.
To make the frosting: In a medium bowl, beat the cream, 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 2 tablespoons coffee liqueur until stiff.
Fold 1/2 cup of cream mixture into filling mixture.
To assemble the cake: Place one plain cake layer on a serving plate.
Pour one third of reserved coffee mixture over cake, then spread with half of the filling mixture.
Top with coffee-flavored cake layer; poke holes in cake.
Pour another third of the coffee mixture over the second layer and spread with the remaining filling.
Top with remaining cake layer; poke holes in cake.
Pour remaining coffee mixture on top.
Spread sides and top of cake with frosting.
Place cocoa in a sieve and lightly dust top of cake.
Garnish with chocolate curls.
Refrigerate at least 30 minutes before serving.

title: ARTICHOKE SPINACH LASAGNA
description: A vegetarian lasagna with artichokes and spinach.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add noodles and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Spray a large skillet with cooking spray and heat on medium-high.
Saute onion and garlic for 3 minutes, or until onion is tender-crisp.
Stir in broth and rosemary; bring to a boil.
Stir in artichoke hearts and spinach; reduce heat, cover and simmer 5 minutes.
Stir in pasta sauce.
Spread 1/4 of the artichoke mixture in the bottom of the prepared baking dish; top with 3 cooked noodles.
Sprinkle 3/4 cup mozzarella cheese over noodles.
Repeat layers 2 more times, ending with artichoke mixture and mozzarella cheese.
Sprinkle crumbled feta on top.
Bake, covered, for 40 minutes.
Uncover, and bake 15 minutes more, or until hot and bubbly.
Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

title: TIRAMISU LAYER CAKE
description: A delicious layered dessert with coffee flavors and mascarpone cheese.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 3 (9 inch) pans.
Prepare the cake mix according to package directions. Divide two thirds of batter between 2 pans. Stir instant coffee into remaining batter; pour into remaining pan.

Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely.
In a measuring cup, combine brewed coffee and 1 tablespoon coffee liqueur; set aside.

To make the filling: In a small bowl, using an electric mixer set on low speed, combine mascarpone, 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar and 2 tablespoons coffee liqueur; beat just until smooth. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate.
To make the frosting: In a medium bowl, using an electric mixer set on medium-high speed, beat the cream, 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 2 tablespoons coffee liqueur until stiff.

To assemble the cake: Place one plain cake layer on a serving plate. Using a thin skewer, poke holes in cake, about 1 inch apart. Pour one third of reserved coffee mixture over cake, then spread with half of the filling mixture.
Top with coffee-flavored cake layer; poke holes in cake. Pour another third of the coffee mixture over the second layer and spread with the remaining filling.
Top with remaining cake layer; poke holes in cake. Pour remaining coffee mixture on top.
Spread sides and top of cake with frosting. Place cocoa in a sieve and lightly dust top of cake.
Refrigerate at least 30 minutes before serving.

title: ARTICHOKE SPINACH LASAGNA
description: A vegetarian lasagna with artichoke hearts and spinach.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add noodles and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Spray a large skillet with cooking spray and heat on medium-high. Saute onion and garlic for 3 minutes, or until onion is tender-crisp.
Stir in broth and rosemary; bring to a boil. Stir in artichoke hearts and spinach; reduce heat, cover and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in pasta sauce.
Spread 1/4 of the artichoke mixture in the bottom of the prepared baking dish; top with 3 cooked noodles.
Sprinkle 3/4 cup mozzarella cheese over noodles. Repeat layers 2 more times, ending with artichoke mixture and mozzarella cheese.
Sprinkle crumbled feta on top.
Bake, covered, for 40 minutes. Uncover, and bake 15 minutes more, or until hot and bubbly.
Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

title: CHICKEN PARMIGIANA
description: Breaded chicken breasts topped with tomato sauce and cheese.
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a medium baking sheet.
Pour egg into a small shallow bowl. Place bread crumbs in a separate shallow bowl.
Dip chicken into egg, then into the bread crumbs. Place coated chicken on the prepared baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until no longer pink and juices run clear.
Pour 1/2 of the spaghetti sauce into a 7x11 inch baking dish. Place chicken over sauce, and cover with remaining sauce.
Sprinkle mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses on top and return to the preheated oven for 20 minutes.

title: PAN-FRIED ASPARAGUS
description: Simple sautéed asparagus with garlic and olive oil.
steps: Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Stir in the olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Cook garlic in butter for a minute, but do not brown.
Add asparagus, and cook for 10 minutes, turning asparagus to ensure even cooking.

title: ITALIAN SAUSAGE, PEPPERS, AND ONIONS
description: Classic Italian sausage with sautéed peppers and onions.
steps: Place the sausage in a large skillet over medium heat, and brown on all sides. Remove from skillet, and slice.
Melt butter in the skillet. Stir in the yellow onion, red onion, and garlic, and cook 2 to 3 minutes.
Mix in red bell pepper and green bell pepper. Season with basil, and oregano. Stir in white wine.
Continue to cook and stir until peppers and onions are tender.
Return sausage slices to skillet with the vegetables. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes, or until sausage is heated through.

title: LEMON CHICKEN PICCATA
description: Chicken breasts in a lemony caper sauce.
steps: Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C). Place a serving platter into the oven to warm.
Season the chicken breast pieces with salt and pepper and dredge them in flour. Shake off excess flour.
Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet; pan-fry the chicken pieces until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side.
Place the chicken pieces onto the warmed platter in the oven.
In the skillet, cook and stir the minced garlic until fragrant, about 20 seconds.
Pour in the chicken broth. Scrape and dissolve any brown bits from the bottom of the skillet.
Stir in the lemon slices and bring the mixture to a boil. Let cook until the sauce reduces to about 2/3 cup, 5 to 8 minutes.
Add the lemon juice and capers; simmer until the sauce is reduced and slightly thickened, about 5 minutes more.
Drop the butter into the skillet and swirl it into the sauce by tilting the skillet until the butter is melted and incorporated.
Add the parsley; remove from heat and set aside.
Arrange the chicken medallions on serving plates and spoon sauce over each portion to serve.

title: LINDA'S LASAGNA
description: Classic lasagna with ground beef and three cheeses.
steps: In a large skillet over medium heat, cook beef until brown. Drain.

In another skillet over medium heat, cook onion until translucent. Combine beef and onion in a large saucepan with tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, water, oregano, garlic powder, salt, pepper and sugar.
Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 1 hour.
While sauce is simmering, blend cottage cheese, Parmesan and egg until smooth. Set aside.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spread 1 cup of sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Cover sauce with 3 noodles.
Cover noodles with one-third of remaining sauce. Top with half the mozzarella.
Place another layer of noodles and one of sauce over the mozzarella; top that with the cottage cheese mixture.
Top with remaining 3 noodles and remaining sauce.
Bake in preheated oven 30 minutes. Sprinkle remaining mozzarella on top and bake 15 minutes more, until golden and bubbly.

title: ANTIPASTO PASTA SALAD
description: Cold pasta salad with Italian meats and cheeses.
steps: Cook the pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain, and cool under cold water.
In a large bowl, combine the pasta, salami, pepperoni, Asiago cheese, black olives, red bell pepper, green bell pepper and tomatoes.
Stir in the envelope of dressing mix. Cover, and refrigerate for at least one hour.
To prepare the dressing, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, oregano, parsley, Parmesan cheese, salt and pepper.
Just before serving, pour dressing over the salad, and mix well.

title: THE BEST MEATBALLS
description: Juicy meatballs made with a blend of ground meats.
steps: Combine beef, veal, and pork in a large bowl. Add garlic, eggs, cheese, parsley, salt and pepper.
Blend bread crumbs into meat mixture. Slowly add the water 1/2 cup at a time. The mixture should be very moist but still hold its shape if rolled into meatballs.
Shape into meatballs.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Fry meatballs in batches.
When the meatball is very brown and slightly crisp remove from the heat and drain on a paper towel.

title: QUICK CHICKEN PICCATA
description: Fast version of the classic chicken piccata.
steps: Place chicken breasts between 2 layers of plastic wrap and pound to about 1/2-inch thick.
Season both sides of chicken breasts with cayenne, salt, and black pepper; dredge lightly in flour and shake off any excess.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Place chicken in the pan, reduce heat to medium, and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side; remove to a plate.
Cook capers in reserved oil, smashing them lightly to release brine, until warmed though, about 30 seconds.
Pour white wine into skillet. Scrape any browned bits from the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Cook until reduced by half, about 2 minutes.
Stir lemon juice, water, and butter into the reduced wine mixture; cook and stir continuously to form a thick sauce, about 2 minutes.
Return chicken breasts to the pan cook until heated through, 1 to 2 minutes. Serve with sauce spooned over the top.

title: Pesto Pasta with Chicken
description: A delicious pasta dish with pesto and chicken.

ingredients.name: chicken breasts
ingredients.note: boneless skinless, cut into bite-size pieces

ingredients.name: sun-dried tomatoes
ingredients.note: oil-packed, drained and cut into strips

steps: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute garlic until tender, then stir in chicken. Season with red pepper flakes. Cook until chicken is golden, and cooked through.
In a large bowl, combine pasta, chicken, sun-dried tomatoes and pesto. Toss to coat evenly.

title: Garlic Butter
description: Simple garlic butter recipe.
steps: In a small bowl, combine softened butter, minced garlic and parmesan cheese. Season with garlic salt, Italian seasoning, pepper and paprika. Mix until smooth.

title: Tacos in Pasta Shells
description: A fusion dish combining tacos and pasta.
steps: In a large skillet, brown beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain. Add cream cheese, salt and chili powder; mix and simmer for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain. Toss cooked shells in butter.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Fill shells with beef mixture and arrange in a 9x13 inch baking dish; pour taco sauce over shells. Cover with foil and bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes.
Remove dish from oven and top with Cheddar cheese, Monterey Jack cheese and tortilla chips; return dish to oven to cook for 15 minutes more.
Top with sour cream and onions; serve.

title: World's Best Pasta Sauce
description: A rich and flavorful pasta sauce.
steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, cook the sausage, beef, onion, and garlic until well browned; drain fat.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and water. Mix in sugar and season with basil, fennel seed, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.

title: Hearty Vegetable Lasagna
description: A vegetarian lasagna packed with vegetables.
steps: Cook the lasagna noodles in a large pot of boiling water for 10 minutes, or until al dente. Rinse with cold water, and drain.
In a large saucepan, cook and stir mushrooms, green peppers, onion, and garlic in oil. Stir in pasta sauce and basil; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer 15 minutes.
Mix together ricotta, 2 cups mozzarella cheese, and eggs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spread 1 cup tomato sauce into the bottom of a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Layer 1/2 each, lasagna noodles, ricotta mix, sauce, and Parmesan cheese. Repeat layering, and top with remaining 2 cups mozzarella cheese.
Bake, uncovered, for 40 minutes. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

title: Tuscan Soup
description: A hearty Italian soup with sausage and vegetables.
steps: Remove skin from sausage and crumble into frying pan. Add chopped onion, and cook over medium heat until meat is no longer pink. If you are trying to cut fat, remove meat from pan, place in a colander, and rinse under cold water.
Place meat in a large pot; add stock and potatoes. Boil until potato is cooked.
Add spinach. Continue boiling until spinach is lightly cooked.
Remove soup from heat, stir in evaporated milk, and season to taste. Do not add any salt if using canned stock.

title: Italian Wedding Soup
description: Traditional Italian soup with meatballs and greens.
steps: In medium bowl, combine meat, egg, bread crumbs, cheese, basil and onion powder; shape into 3/4 inch balls.

In large saucepan, heat broth to boiling; stir in escarole, orzo pasta, chopped carrot and meatballs. Return to boil, then reduce heat to medium. Cook at slow boil for 10 minutes, or until pasta is al dente. Stir frequently to prevent sticking.

title: Baked Ziti with Sausage
description: Classic baked pasta dish with Italian sausage.
steps: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

Fill a large pot of lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, stir in the ziti, and return to a boil. Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta has cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain well in a colander set in the sink.
While pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sausage, and cook and stir until brown, about 10 minutes. Drain sausage and set aside.

Stir together the ricotta, egg, onion, garlic, and oregano in a large bowl until well combined. Stir in the drained pasta, the drained sausage, salt, pepper, and 1/2 jar of the spaghetti sauce; mix well.

In the prepared baking dish, cover the bottom with 1/3 jar of spaghetti sauce. Layer 1/2 of the pasta mixture, 1/3 jar of spaghetti sauce, and 1/2 of the shredded cheese. Then layer the remaining 1/2 of the pasta, 1/3 of the sauce, and 1/2 of the cheese. Sprinkle with basil. Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 20 minutes. Uncover; return to the oven and bake until cheese is melted, 5 to 10 more minutes.

title: Pesto
description: Classic Italian basil pesto sauce.
steps: Combine basil, garlic, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, and nuts in the bowl of a food processor or blender. Blend to a smooth paste. Add parsley if desired.

title: Manicotti alla Romana
description: Traditional Roman-style stuffed pasta dish.
steps: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion, carrot, shallot, and prosciutto until onion is translucent and prosciutto releases some fat, about 10 minutes. Add pork and beef; season with 1 teaspoon nutmeg, cinnamon, and salt to taste. Cook and stir over medium-high heat until browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes.

Pour red wine over meat mixture; increase heat and cook until wine evaporates, about 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and mix well; bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes break down and flavors of Bolognese sauce have combined, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat; add flour. Whisk vigorously until mixture is smooth. Pour in milk and cook, stirring occasionally, over medium heat until white sauce thickens enough to cover the back of a spoon, about 10 minutes; season with 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, salt, and pepper.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook lasagna noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Lay noodles on a clean towel and pat dry.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Pour a ladleful of Bolognese sauce and a ladleful of white sauce over the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish; top with 3 or 4 lasagna noodles. Cover noodles with 1/3 of the white sauce and 1/3 of the Bolognese sauce. Sprinkle some of the Parmesan cheese on top; cover with lasagna noodles. Repeat layers, ending with white sauce and Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbling and top is golden brown, 30 to 40 minutes. Let stand 3 to 4 minutes before slicing.
